Session 1 Pen and Paper Facilitator: Claus Aichinger Pen & Paper Before we start coding, let’s think. Familiarize yourself with the problem: Find a common language. Identify concepts. Make a sketch. Be explicit. Tips Sometimes “A picture is worth a thousand words”. If you prefer a digital sketching solution: https://cocreate.csail.mit.edu/. Extra Challenge Optional, for experienced participants: Use your left hand. Not recommended, only for crazy participants:

Session 2 First attempt to make small steps Facilitator: Peter Kofler, @codecopkofler TDD with Ping Pong Let’s do TDD and Pair Programming in a strict way, switching after each increment: A writes a test and sees that it fails. B writes the code needed to pass the test. A (or B) refactors the code as needed. B writes next test and sees that it fails. A writes the code needed to pass the test.

Session 3 Make Even Smaller Steps! Facilitator: Paul Rohorzka, @paulroho Take Baby Steps! Why Should I Take Baby Steps?
